place.name: FARRINGTON GURNEY
place.gazetteerText: FARRINGTON-GURNEY, a parish in Clutton district, Somerset; near the line of projected railway from Bristol to Frome, 8 miles SW of Twerton r. station, and 8i NNE of Wells. It has a post office under Bristol. Acres, 923. Real property, £6, 294; of which £594 are in mines. Pop., 482. Houses, 113. The manor belonged formerly to the Gourneys, and belongs now to the duchy of Cornwall. The living is a vicarage, annexed to the vicarage of Stone - Easton, in the diocese of Bath and Wells. The church is good; and there is a Wesleyan ehapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
